metaDescription: Eksklusiv 4-bedroom villa in prestigious Cucarres, Calpe. 410m² built on 660m² plot. Premium coastal living at €4,512/m² - 20% less than Jávea.
heroIntro: Welcome to an exceptional property in Cucarres, one of Calpe's most prestigious residential enclaves. This sophisticated 4-bedroom, 6-bathroom villa represents the pinnacle of contemporary Mediterranean living on the Costa Blanca. With 410 square metres of thoughtfully designed living space set upon a generous 660-square-metre plot, this is a rare offering that combines architectural excellence with an enviable location. Priced at €1,850,000—representing outstanding value at €4,512 per square metre, notably 20% more accessible than comparable properties in nearby Jávea—this villa appeals to the most discerning international buyers seeking premium specification without compromise. The property benefits from Calpe's exceptional Mediterranean climate, with over 300 days of sunshine annually, proximity to world-class amenities, and a thriving expat community of English-speaking residents. Whether as a principal residence, investment asset, or sophisticated retreat, this exclusive villa offers the refined lifestyle that luxury Costa Blanca properties are renowned for delivering.
areaSection: Calpe, nestled between the dramatic Peñón de Ifach rock and the Mediterranean Sea, is one of Spain's most coveted coastal destinations. This charming port town sits on the northern Costa Blanca, approximately 60 kilometres north of Alicante airport and just 45 kilometres south of Valencia. The municipality enjoys a temperate Mediterranean climate with average temperatures of 17°C in winter and 28°C in summer, making it an ideal year-round residence. Calpe's geography—surrounded by both mountains and sea—creates a unique microclimate that attracts both holidaymakers and permanent residents. The town has evolved from a traditional fishing village into a sophisticated cosmopolitan destination while retaining its authentic Spanish character. Its position along the Costa Blanca means access to some of Spain's finest beaches, world-class restaurants, and outdoor recreation opportunities, all within a vibrant international community.
lifestyleSection: Living in Calpe means embracing a refined Mediterranean lifestyle with exceptional convenience. The town hosts a thriving international community, particularly British and German residents, creating a cosmopolitan atmosphere where English is widely spoken in restaurants, shops, and professional services. Daily life centres around the picturesque port area, where fresh seafood restaurants line the waterfront, and the vibrant weekly market offers local produce and artisan goods. The Arenal-Bol beach, awarded Blue Flag status, provides a stunning backdrop for morning swims and evening paseos. For sophisticated entertainment, the town offers galleries, cultural events, and a selection of Michelin-recommended restaurants. The established healthcare infrastructure includes private clinics with English-speaking practitioners, whilst excellent international schools serve families with children. Shopping needs are met by quality supermarkets including Mercadona and Más y Más, alongside boutiques in the charming old town. The proximity to championship golf courses, combined with the upcoming TRAM connection, makes Calpe an increasingly attractive destination for executives and retirees seeking an elevated Mediterranean experience.
investmentSection: This villa represents a compelling investment opportunity in one of Spain's most resilient property markets. Calpe property prices have demonstrated consistent growth, with the Costa Blanca region experiencing a year-on-year appreciation of approximately 7%—significantly outpacing European residential market averages. At €4,512 per square metre, this property commands a premium specification while remaining 20% more accessible than comparable Jávea properties, offering exceptional value within the luxury segment. The Costa Blanca's rental market supports typical weekly lettings of €1,000 for premium properties, suggesting annual rental yields between 2.7-3.2% depending on management strategy. Calpe's established international community, combined with its port-town authenticity and upcoming TRAM infrastructure, positions it for sustained appreciation. The property's four-bedroom configuration appeals to both family buyers and investment portfolios seeking diversified income streams through holiday lettings or long-term rental arrangements.
conclusion: This exceptional villa in prestigious Cucarres represents a rare convergence of investment merit and lifestyle excellence. At €1,850,000, you acquire not merely property, but entrée to an established international community, proven appreciation markets, and Mediterranean living of genuine sophistication. The four-bedroom configuration, six-bathroom luxury, and generous 660-square-metre plot deliver the space and comfort expected by discerning owners, whilst Calpe's 7% annual growth rate and €1,000+ weekly rental potential support long-term wealth building. Whether your objective is principal residence, investment diversification, or sophisticated retreat, this villa merits serious consideration. Contact our team directly via WhatsApp for private viewings, financial planning assistance, and detailed property documentation. Your Mediterranean future awaits in Calpe.

From private healthcare with English-speaking practitioners to international schools, quality shopping, and cultural attractions, the town delivers the convenience and lifestyle standards expected by discerning property owners.

healthcare.text: Calpe offers excellent healthcare access combining Spanish NHS facilities with private practitioners catering to international residents. The Centro de Salud Calp provides immediate local medical services including emergency care, whilst private clinics throughout town employ English-speaking doctors and medical staff. The Hospital de Dénia, located 30 kilometres south, serves as the regional medical centre for specialised treatments, routinely rated amongst Spain's finest. Many British and international residents utilise private healthcare insurance for seamless access to English-language consultations, prescription services, and specialist referrals. Dental and optometry services meet international standards, with practitioners experienced in treating expatriate communities.

education.text: Families relocating to Calpe benefit from established international education options delivering globally-recognised curricula. Lady Elizabeth School in nearby Cumbre del Sol (10 kilometres) provides British-curriculum education for primary and secondary students, serving the English-speaking community for over two decades. For families seeking further afield education, Laude Newton College offers British-curriculum provision 35 kilometres away. Spanish state schools provide high-quality education at minimal cost for families wishing to integrate fully into local communities. The town's international demographic means schools are experienced in supporting relocated families and multilingual education approaches.

shopping.text: Calpe provides comprehensive shopping facilities combining hypermarkets, speciality boutiques, and authentic local markets. Mercadona and Más y Más supermarkets deliver international brands alongside Spanish staples, with English-speaking staff common in established stores. The weekly market in the town centre offers fresh produce, meats, fish, and artisan goods directly from local suppliers, maintaining traditional Mediterranean shopping culture. For designer and luxury goods, nearby Benidorm (20 kilometres) hosts international shopping centres. The charming old town features independent shops, galleries, and boutiques reflecting Calpe's cosmopolitan character.

transport.text: Calpe offers exceptional transport connectivity for European travel and regional exploration. Alicante airport—Spain's third-largest international hub—sits 65 kilometres south with direct flights to major European cities, whilst Valencia airport (100 kilometres) provides alternative routes for northern European destinations. Public bus services connect Calpe to Benidorm, Valencia, and surrounding towns, with the announced TRAM system promising enhanced connectivity from 2024. For driving, the AP-7 motorway provides swift access throughout the Costa Blanca and toward Valencia. Many residents maintain vehicles for independence, though established public transport and the international community's taxis services provide convenient alternatives.

faqs.answer: Spanish property ownership involves annual Impuesto sobre Bienes Inmuebles (IBI) property tax—typically 0.4-0.6% of registered property value—plus community fees if applicable. Utilities and maintenance costs align with European standards. We recommend consulting a Spanish tax advisor for personalised financial planning.
